hints.content:
The bar for Snow Slope lines up with $\blueD{40}$ on the scale.  


[[☃ image 1]]

Snow Slope is $\blueD{40}$ meters tall.

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Sledding Hill and the vertical axis labeled Height in meters. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: Blizzard Run, Winter Hill, Snow Slope, and Frozen Field. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, and 80. The bar line for each type of sledding hill shows the following: Blizzard Run bar line extends to 70, Winter Hill bar line extends to 60, Snow Slope bar line extends to 40, and Frozen Field bar line extends to 10. A blue line is drawn to the right from 40, which reaches to the end of the Snow Slope bar line. !

hints.content:
The bar for Blizzard Run lines up with $\purpleD{70}$ on the scale.  


[[☃ image 1]]

Blizzard Run is $\purpleD{70}$ meters tall.

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Sledding Hill and the vertical axis labeled Height in meters. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: Blizzard Run, Winter Hill, Snow Slope, and Frozen Field. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, and 80. The bar line for each type of sledding hill shows the following: Blizzard Run bar line extends to 70, Winter Hill bar line extends to 60, Snow Slope bar line extends to 40, and Frozen Field bar line extends to 10. A purple line is drawn to the right from 70, which reaches to the end of the Blizzard Run bar line. !

hints.content: Snow Slope is $\greenD{30}$ meters shorter than Blizzard Run.

question.content:
Dina measured the heights of her favorite snow day sledding hills and graphed the results.  


[[☃ image 1]]

**How many meters shorter is Snow Slope than Blizzard Run?**

[[☃ input-number 1]] meters

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Sledding Hill and the vertical axis labeled Height in meters. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: Blizzard Run, Winter Hill, Snow Slope, and Frozen Field. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, and 80. The bar line for each type of sledding hill shows the following: Blizzard Run bar line extends to 70, Winter Hill bar line extends to 60, Snow Slope bar line extends to 40, and Frozen Field bar line extends to 10. !
